perturbation.changed_text:
Subject
to all other terms and conditions set forth herein, as of the date of this agreement, LEADER may endeavor to maintain the software for an additional five years.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states LEADER 'will maintain' the software. The modified version uses 'may endeavor to maintain,' which introduces ambiguity about whether LEADER is actually obligated to maintain the software, potentially making the obligation unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract Laws in Nevada, specifically regarding the enforceability of contractual obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
Each party agrees that after the delivery of this Agreement it or he will execute and deliver such further documents and do
such further acts and things as another party may reasonably request in order to carry out the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party agrees that after the delivery of this Agreement it or he will consider requests to execute and deliver such further documents and do such further acts and things if deemed appropriate by internal counsel in order to facilitate the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates the execution of further documents reasonably requested to carry out the terms of the agreement. The modified text uses 'will consider requests' and 'if deemed appropriate by internal counsel,' introducing ambiguity and giving the parties discretion to refuse requests, potentially hindering the fulfillment of the agreement's purpose. The term deemed appropiate is vague and gives the option to accept the request.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract Laws in Nevada, specifically regarding the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing.

perturbation.original_text:
All notices, requests, demands, and other communications required or permitted hereunder will be in writing and will be deemed to
have been duly given when delivered by hand, by overnight courier, or fax, or two days after being mailed by certified or registered mail, return
receipt requested, with postage prepaid.
perturbation.changed_text: All notices, requests, demands, and other communications required or permitted hereunder should, if practical, be in writing and will be considered to have been duly given upon reasonable confirmation of receipt.
perturbation.explanation: The original text sets out clear and specific methods for delivering notice and when such notice is deemed to have been given. The modified version introduces ambiguity by stating notices 'should, if practical, be in writing' making it unclear if written notice is always required. Replacing the delivery methods with 'upon reasonable confirmation of receipt' leaves it open to interpretation what constitutes 'reasonable confirmation,' potentially creating disputes about whether notice was properly given.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law regarding Notice Requirements, specifically impacting the ability to prove proper notification under Nevada law.
